header.title: Dynamic Facebook Open Graph and Twitter Meta Tags
header.description: This mod provides Facebook Open Graph and Twitter Card Meta Tags. It includes posting the initial attachment and posting content within the meta tags. This will allow your facebook and twitter postings to contain any posted image and contain text from the initial posting.
header.author-notes: This product is release candidate ready. We are waiting for a few additional sites testing the product before submitting for database submission.

link-group.link: Support and Modification Forum Location at phpBB.com

changelog.change: New Feature: Enabled options to select first image or last image in topic.
New Feature: Added support for Video BBCode. You are required to use bbcode of [video][/video]. If you use an alternate model, you will need to edit the source code.
Fixed issue with length of description for twitter to be only 140 charaters long.

action-group.diy-instructions:
Step 1:
This mod requires a canonical URL modification to be installed for the og:url and twitter:url meta tags. phpBB does not have a template tag for the current page URL. For this feature to work will require a dependent mod to be installed. Options: 1. Canonical URL. This is listed in the Additional Files section to edit. This mod is written with this dependency.
2. phpBB-SEO. If you already have phpBB-SEO installed, then you can replace the {U_CANONICAL} with {SEO_CANONICAL_URL}.
3. Other Mods If you have some other mod that provides the current page. This can be a variety of share it type of mods. You will need to find the corresponding tag and swap it out for the {U_CANONICAL} tag.
Step 2: You will need to replace "***Default image URL Goes Here***" with the URL for your default image. Your non-topic pages and your topics that do not contain an image attachment will require a default image. This will need to be the full url to the image including the http://.
Step 3:
Permissions. Facebook uses a crawler/spider to collect the page information. If you have Facebook defined as a crawler, you will need to give crawlers access to download images. This is accomplished by going to: a. Login to the ACP b. Select "Permissions" tab. c. Select "Group Permissions" in the left column. d. Select "Crawlers" from the drop down box and click the "Submit" button. e. Click the "Advanced Permissions" link in the right side of the white box. f. The option called "Can download files", click the radio button for "Yes". g. Click the "Apply Permissions" button.
Step 4:
Test. You can go to Facebook Developers Toolbox and test your Open Graph tags at http://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/.
Setp 5: The code will select the first image available. if you would like the last image used, you will need to change the $first_image to false.
I hope this helps.
